full_summary:
# Request for Proposal

## Opportunities and Scope
The Government of Canada is seeking a contractor to provide field support for air monitoring at the Great Lakes Monitoring site of Point Petre, Ontario. The objective of this request is to contract with a supplier who can assist Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) in maintaining and operating the site, while ensuring the long-term integrity of the monitoring data.

## Background Information
The Great Lakes Monitoring site of Point Petre, Ontario, is part of the Canadian government's Chemicals Management Plan and contributes to the International Pollutant Dispersal and Deposition (IPDD) Assessment Model. As part of the project, the supplier will provide field support for the operation of air quality instrumentation, including the collection and tracking of sampling media.

## Scope of Work
The successful contractor will be responsible for conducting monitoring sampling and maintaining the site according to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP). Tasks will include:

* Collecting samples from various air quality sampling devices
* Tracking and documenting sampling media, field information, and meteorological conditions
* Preparing and shipping samples to analysis laboratories
* Calibrating high-volume samplers as needed
* Providing maintenance and minor repairs to sampling equipment
* Assuring the upkeep of the monitoring site and its property

## Requirements
The following are key requirements for the successful contractor:

* The ability to operate in a remote area
* Familiarity with Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
* Knowledge of air quality sampling and instrumentation
* Strong communication and documentation skills

## Important Contact Information
* Contact Person: Mitchell Palmer, mitchell.palmer@ec.gc.ca
* Telephone: 819-938-3190

## Request for Proposal Documents
The request for proposal document is available for download at: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/11/30/3853878bb3bd918c6b30ab231a91ab23/5000060850r_finalrfp_en.pdf
